channel.title: Xbox 360, ps3 or nintendo revolution?
channel.description:
prices : xbox 360 : $399 nintendo revolution : - the price is not official - but nintendo is aiming at $99 ps3 : playstation ( sony ) reports that a ps3 costs $494 to make,
i personnaly chose for the ps3 bq it has the most powerfull processor, but i have a small problem with my budget ;D [img]http://hitech.typepad.com/photos/uncategorized/xbox360_ps3_nintendo_revolution_size.jpg[/img]

item.title: Xbox 360, ps3 or nintendo revolution?
item.dc:creator: @David David
item.description:
@David wrote:

Xbox360. As anyone with a brain would get.

It has more games than a PS3
It has Halo3.
It has an ultimate online system which will be explained.
Cheaper.

Nothing’s wrong with the wii, but it’s not your classic “Sit down and play games to relax” console. Which is… Different…

PS3 will just be a bag of wank, nothing new except graphics, which are going to be the same as the 360’s unless you have an HD TV.

XBox Live is ultimate. It’s expanding, so far and fast. You PS3 fanboys will be pissed off when you buy your console, as you realise you’re stuck with the same junk you’ve had for the past 4 years.

Xbox Live can go on 5 mediums:

Xbox
Xbox360
Windows Vista
Mobile Phones
The Zune.

This is all from one gamertag, and you can play all the arcade games that you have from there.

Trust me, if any of you had common sense, you’d get the 360.

If you’re still thinking about getting the PS3. Do some research on the 360.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360, ps3 or nintendo revolution?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

It’s called the Wii!

Also, Xbox’s processor is already overdoing it. You also get to pay more money for other unnecessary items, such as a 60 gig HD. What the fuck do you need that for? “Music.” I stream mine from my PC. “Videos.” I can also stream that from my PC. And I sure as hell know that game saves are going to take that much.

You also have to take into consideration, when PS3 comes out at it’s default 500$, Xbox 360 will be atleast 50-100$ cheaper. And, Xbox 360 gave developers will have a headstart while PS3’s are still fiddling around with what they have.

Xbox 360 has support for Wireless 802.11 A networks, which is better than PS3’s support for only B and G wirelesss networking.

Read full topic
